Perceptor:

"Most of us need a good rest" said Dryly thge male"and We need others to go 
to CR, and I need Rodimus's help to bring back Nightlight... And I hope that 
you never lost your temper togehter me"

-----Original Message----- 
From: Sandy
Sent: Monday, April 18, 2011 12:05 AM
To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: BATTLE at the Ark!

Tucson may not have liked what he heard, but Perceptor was right, it would 
be far too harmful for Hydras to get what he wanted and that's not what 
Tucson wanted.   He sighs.

"I understand Perceptor, no such action will be taken. Yet I do not intend 
for Hydras to get away with his crimes.  He may have retreated for now, but 
it's not enough.  I made a promise to all of you that tables would be 
turned.  I don't intend to go back on that promise by any means.  But 
first.. "

He stops, transforms into vehicle mode, and opens his cab door to reveal 
Talon inside.

"I wish for Talon to be resting comofortably in a safe place."

Straight Shot sighs.

"Wheww, when he transforms into vehicle mode, I know he's calmed down.  He 
doesn't do that when he's ticked off."

" You should consider yourself lucky that you're on my good side Straight 
Shot."

She gives him a wry look and kicks a tire hard.

" Ow!"

Straght Shot leans up against him.

" You so deserved that and you know it, hot head!"

He replies back, a bit crestfallen.

" All right, I get the message.  I was out of line."

Straight Shot smirks.

"That's more like it.  Don't take it the wrong way Rodimus, Tucson's always 
had a nasty temper, even when he was just an average Autobot. I can remember 
a lotta bar room fights and all those times where he'd smash a con's face to 
unrecognizable smitherines."

Tucson also adds in his part.

"She's right, I never lost my temper around Autobots, only Decepticons.  But 
I would get agitated with certain Autobots from time to time..  But that's 
as far as that went."

Straight Shot nodds.

" I remember that.  Sort of what Ratchet was like back in the days.  Great 
medic, Brilliant individual, but he also had a nasty temper. That kinda 
rubbed off on you big guy."

Tucson sighs.

" Before I became a warrior, I do remember helping Ratchet periodically with 
Supply runs. I'd get what he needed and deliver the goods safely back to the 
Iacon med bay.  Then, I'd actually watch him repair damaged Autobots.  When 
I wasn't fighting, I was using my spare time to restore old weaponry and 
artifacts.  I got to learn a lot about simple repair work, simply by 
watching Ratchet, and taking his good advice.  That was all before my 
unfortunate run in with Cyclonus."

Straight Shot looks up to Rodimus.

" Of course, when he was needed on the battlefield, Tucson was always there, 
on time, no matter where he was or what he was doing.  I guess his temper 
stems from the need to see a job well done all the way through.  Hydras is 
disrupting that sense of stability, and that's what's really making Tucson 
angry.  If given the opportunity, would you allow him to face Hydras once 
again, to try and even the score?  I really think he needs that if he's 
gonna find personal closure."

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Airshadow Nightstar <airly2002@...> wrote:
>
> Perce alter itoptor:
>
> "That isnt possible"said Perceptor by comlink"We willbe altering the 
> history
> and hydras would have a better chance to capture Megatron's spark if he
> wants, as in Beast wars... They have to remain here is the only way that
> things should be"
>
>
> riginal Message----- 
> From: Sandy
> Sent: Saturday, April 16, 2011 9:12 AM
> To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: Re: BATTLE at the Ark!
>
> Taking some hard breaths, Tucson lowers his arm, and allows Straight Shot 
> to
> transform and stand beside him.  She sighs in relief.  She looks up to 
> him.
>
> " That was way too close that time Tucson.  Rodimus is right, what was 
> that
> all about?"
>
> Tucson turns his attentions to Rodimus and Straight Shot.
>
> " I - I don't know.  I'm sorry.  Of course, no harm will come to anyone
> here, Legacy, Rodimus, excuse my actions, they were not done with the best
> of judgement."
>
> Straight Shot looks to Tucson, and this time with a concerned look on her
> face.
>
> " Ever since that day, you haven't been the same.  I know, I was there, 
> and
> lemme tell ya it haunts me too.  Have ya ever thought ta open up about it
> Tucson?  Maybe that would kinda help ya heal a little bit.  The wounds are
> still fresh, even though that fight was a long time ago."
>
> Tucson nodds.
>
> " You're right.  Rodimus, Legacy, I've been keeping something from you for 
> a
> long time, and that's not what a respectable leader does.  A leader may be
> strong but he too, must open up about the issues that weaken his state of
> mind.  It all started on the day of that battle, that had Rodimus abducted
> and taken over by Hydras and his forces.  I fought in that battle as a
> soldier. And being a Ninjabot myself, I knew of Nightrazor's properties, 
> yet
> I felt that if I barged in on Rodimus, it would only land me with a case 
> of
> insubordination.  So, I refrained from doing so, but tried to divert enemy
> attentions indirectly.  For the most part it worked and I was able to 
> fight
> my way through those who knew nothing about Ninjabot combat.  Yet, there
> were seekers who were far more swift on their wings then I was on my 
> wheels.
> They were bearing down on the Autobots, to the point that I felt that if I
> did not step in, there wouldn't be an Autobot left to defend the Ark or 
> the
> planet."
>
> He pauses.
>
> " From what I remember, I transformed into my vehicle mode, and started to
> kick up dirt from my tires, in hopes that a seeker would see what I was up
> to.  It worked, and I grabbed the attention of several, although I 
> couldn't
> see who they were because they were rather high up from me.  Then, 
> suddenly,
> I was struck.  And I don't remember anything more than that.  A long time
> afterwards, I was brought back online, and when I woke up, I could only 
> see
> darkness.  At first, I thought it was a power outage, but then, I was told
> that my optic sensors were completely destroyed by the cranial shot that I
> had endured during that chase.  I asked about you Rodimus, but, no one 
> could
> tell me what happened.  It was at that point where I knew that I failed 
> you
> If only I had listened to myself the first time, and came in front of you
> when you were chasing Nightrazor that first time.  You would not have
> suffered as you had, nor would your family. And since then, I pledged to 
> get
> back on my feet, and never let my defenses down again, and if I had to, 
> I'd
> strike back harder than any Decepticon or Predacon could ever fathom.  I
> failed you once Rodimus, and I pledged NEVER to let that happen again."
>
> Straight Shot looks to Tucson with a thoughtful gaze.
>
> "Wow, you never even told me all that before.  Well, since we're opening 
> up
> about it, I wish I could help you guys understand what happened, but I 
> only
> remember a little bit more than he does. Right before he got shot, I saw
> Cyclonus decending just a tad closser to us than the other seekers that 
> were
> following us.  I saw him take the shot and I screamed, and that's when
> everything went blank.  I think what would really help Tucson now, is
> knowing that what happened, really wasn't his fault."
>
> Tucson now turns his head toward Megatron's body.
>
> " Having the Decepticons here amongst us is highly un nerving to me. 
> There
> must be a way to separate them from the Autobots, and place them in a safe
> location...  Wait, I remember something..  The Decepticons had their own
> craft, The Nemisis...  Why couldn't we return them to their rightful craft
> and separate them from the Autobots, where both factions would be safe 
> from
> harm?  Rodimus, due to circumbstances which I have just told you, for my 
> own
> emotional stability, I can not have these Decepticons here.  But I'm 
> willing
> to help preserve them in a safe location away from the Ark.  Legacy, if 
> you
> could, I'd like you to find out where the Nemisis is now located and if it
> is within reach.  Once located, I want the Decepticons brought safely back
> to their own ship, where they can rest in peace, thus leaving the Ark to 
> the
> Autobots to do the same."
>
> Straight Shot smiles.
>
> "Now that's more like the Tucson I know.  I like that idea, I like it 
> alot."
>
> Outside the Ark, Uproar and Quickstride look to each other and just shrug
> off the event.
>
> "Hmm, oh well, would've been fun ta see them end up in the tar pit but,
> works for me, Uproar."
>
> Uproar nodds.
>
> "Ditto.  Okay, so, I guess we can go back inside."
>
> They get into beast mode, and prance back into the Ark. Yet, Uproar could
> not help but look back with a perplexed look on his face.
>
> --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Super Cyclonus <supercyclonus@> wrote:
> >
> > INSIDE THE ARK:
> >
> > > Hydras did a final shot and send a secret message to Nightrazor "The
> > > door
> > is open, time to leave"and said in loud voice "PREDACONS... RETREAT!!!!"
> > > Hydras picked up inferno and started to leave the area
> >
> > > [Tuscon's] eyes narrow dangerously.
> > >
> > > "THAT'S IT! I'VE HAD ENOUGH!"
> > >
> > > He senses where Megatron's body was laying down, and slams his foot on
> > > his
> > chest, pointing an arrow straight for it!
> > >
> > > " HYDRAS, NIGHTRAZOR, CYCLONUS, SCOURGE! IF YOU ARE WITHIN RANGE OF MY
> > COMMUNICATIONS HEAR THIS! YOU DARE TO HARM MY FELLOW MAXIMALS AND
> > AUTOBOTS,
> > AND THREATEN TO TAKE THEIR LIVES! WELL, I HAVE NEWS FOR YOU TOO! YOU'VE
> > LEFT
> > ME NO CHOICE BUT TO DO THE SAME TO YOU AS WELL! I HAVE MEGATRON'S BODY
> > UNDER
> > MY FOOT, AND AN ARROW STRAIGHT FOR HIS CHEST CHAMBER! YOU STEP FOOT ANY
> > FURTHER INTO MY ARK, TAKE ANOTHER AUTOBOT OR MAXIMAL AND I SWEAR I'LL BE
> > SURE HE NEVER WAKES UP! PERIOD!"
> > >
> > > His voice echoes throught the Ark. With each word he rattles the Ark,
> > voice booming like that of an angry lion. He was sick of the Predacons 
> > and
> > Decepticon's attack on his Ark, and he holds his position over Megatron
> > and
> > awaits their response before doing anything to anyone. Yet, the arrow
> > remains pointed for a perfect shot to the fallen Megatron's chest!
> > >
> > > He then turns his head to Rodimus.
> > >
> > > " I want you to know you have full permission to permanently disable 
> > > any
> > predacons or Decepticons you see fit. Scour the parameters of the Ark, 
> > and
> > be sure no one gets in, Rodimus. I'll handle Nightrazor in here."
> >
> > <NEW>
> >
> > Rodimus looked at Tuscon, a look of complete surprise on his face, "What
> > are
> > you doing?" he said as he looked at Tuscon and then at the weapon that 
> > was
> > being pointed at Megatron.
> >
> > "Tuscon, Hydras is already retreating! LOOK!" he said, pointing at 
> > Hydras
> > who had picked up his fallen teammate and was already moving out of the
> > Ark.
> >
> >
> > At this same time Legacy also stepped into the room, coming from one of
> > the
> > back corridors into the front. As a guardian, it was his job, his 
> > internal
> > directive to keep the Ark and all of its occupants safe, an imperative
> > that
> > would also include even the Decepticons that were to wake up several
> > million
> > years later.
> >
> > Legacy's single optic pulsed as he took in the scene, Hydras leaving and
> > Tuscon pointing a weapon at Megatron to ensure that he did so.
> >
> > "NONE OF THE ARK'S OCCUPANTS ARE TO COME TO HARM." Legacy said, falling
> > into
> > his old coldly logical voice. His voice sounded nothing if not more
> > formal,
> > his tones frigid, his words clear as crystal, and his stance firm and
> > resolved. Legacy pointedly glanced at Straight Shot and then back at
> > Tuscon,
> > "TO PUT OUR FUTURE IN JEOPARDY TO RESOLVE THIS ISSUE IS NOT ACCEPTABLE."
> >
> > > <OLD>
> > >
> > > PErceptor gain control of the ark and activate all the internal 
> > > defences
> > against the Hydra's predacons and tried to
> >
> > <NEW>
> >
> > As preceptor worked, the Ark began to respond to his commands as weapons
> > began to activate, internal defenses systems came online.
> >
> > "What is your command?" Teletran 1 asked Perceptor.
> >
> >
> > MEANWHILE IN THE MEDICAL BAY:
> >
> > > <OLD>
> > >
> > > Nightlight continue peacefully sleeping while Elita jumped on the bed 
> > > in
> > her beast form and nuzzled in her mom's cheek while she cried in 
> > silence.
> > > "Mommie"said Elita" I miss you so much... so much"sobbed the little 
> > > girl
> > while her tears fell in her mom's cheek
> >
> > <NEW>
> >
> > Nightlight continued to sleep, as all around her the machines registered
> > her
> > as resting in a comma like state. All of her systems seemed otherwise in
> > stable condition.
> >
> > Ramulus looked at Nightlight and Elita, a soft look on his face.
> >
> > Then Tuscon's voice boomed through, threatening the Predacons. "SLAG!"
> > Ramulus said as he glanced back at Elita, "You stay here." Ramulus said.
> > "I'm going to lock you in and then go see if anything can be done for 
> > our
> > medical staff."
> >
> > Ramulus spoke as he quickly gathered up a few med packs and a scanner.
> > "Danged daft Predacons, causing so much damage." Ramulus grumbled under
> > his
> > breath. Ramulus was no medic, but he did know a bit about first aid.
> > Perhaps
> > there was something he could so for Santon and Bump who were still lying
> > on
> > the floor of the corridors. Perhaps they were not as . . . hurt as they
> > looked. He couldn't even bring himself to think of them as dead.
> >
> > With a last look at Elita he left. The door clicked as he locked it and
> > then
> > the room that Elita was in went silent except for the computer monitors
> > that
> > were watching over Nightlight.
> >
> > For the moment all was peaceful in the medbay.
> >
> > However outside the Ark was a very different matter!
> >
> > > <OLD>
> > >
> > > Windlord and Kup keep their fire against Scourge and Deepstrike
> >
> > <NEW>
> >
> > As the firefight continues Deepstryke took a hit, as did Scourge, 
> > forcing
> > them to break off their attack on the door and swing up into the air to
> > avoid any further and more critical damage. Several more of the sweeps
> > were
> > blasted from the skies, the last one swinging up next to his master
> > Scourge,
> > almost as if for protection.
> >
> > The Predacons were looking decidedly more damaged and a bit more tired
> > then
> > before. Energon looked to be looking a bit lower than before and the 
> > shots
> > from Windlord and Kup were building up on them, not to mention the
> > firepower
> > coming from the fuzors as well as Leo II! Yes, the Predacons had 
> > breached
> > the door, but getting further in would be an uphill battle indeed, and
> > many
> > of them did not look to be in the best shape to fight it!
> >
> > > <OLD>
> > >
> > > Meanwhile, Outside, Quickstride quickly gets Uproar to his feet, and
> > assesses the situation. He then looks around the parameters and then
> > remembers a body of goop, that resembled a tar pit, not far from the 
> > Ark's
> > parameters. Uproar looks to him.
> >
> > *<SNIP/CUT/PASTE>*
> >
> > >
> > > Uproar and Quickstride now approach Deep Stryke and the others with
> > > their
> > hands up in submission. Quickstride is the first to approach them.
> >
> > <NEW>
> >
> > Deepstryke hovered in the air as he noticed the two walked towards him,
> > his
> > cannons swiveling to track them when they spoke . . .
> >
> > > <OLD>
> > >
> > > "Okay, okay, you got us, you got us. Why don't we just show you guys 
> > > an
> > easy way inta the ark hmm? That way we all get what we want and 
> > everyone's
> > happy."
> >
> > <NEW>
> >
> > "You, a Maximal would show a Predacon a way into his own fortress?"
> > Deepstryke said, obviously not believing the two for a moment, and yet 
> > he
> > didn't shoot at them either. Perhaps there was a part of him that WANTED
> > to
> > believe it. Then Hydras' call went out to retreat!
> >
> > "Blast you Maximal!" Deepstryke said as he began to pull back. "NEXT 
> > TIME
> > we
> > will breach your walls and TAKE what we want!"
> >
> > The Predacons began to back up, moving into the air, slowly moving away
> > from
> > the Ark, even as the Ark's cannons and weaponry began to move and come
> > online.
> >
> > (TAG)
